posts.post_content:
Exact same text as [Lightning Helix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Helix)!  
  
This card is obviously unplayable in constructed, but people give it far too little credit here in the comments. In M13 limited, Essence Drain is a completely fine card, and is even first picked by professionals in weaker packs.
posts.html:
Exact same text as Lightning Helix!

This card is obviously unplayable in constructed, but people give it far too little credit here in the comments. In M13 limited, Essence Drain is a completely fine card, and is even first picked by professionals in weaker packs.

Posted By: Henrietta (9/6/2012 9:54:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Henrietta below me is entirely right. This card is first pickable in certain cases, and should (almost) always make the cut in a black deck. It's expensive, but a fatastic topdeck that changes the race more than most other removal. And combined with [Sign In Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign In Blood), it can burn out opponents, giving black some welcome reach.

Posted By: Arcanoi (7/7/2012 12:09:19 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This card just won me a draft.  
It's not great, but don't forget that limited tends to be pretty slow. Not only does it blow up a creature (I found myself rarely casting it on a player, except for the win), but the 3 life gain is pretty strong. This, [Bloodhunter Bat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bloodhunter Bat) and [Mark of the Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mark of the Vampire).  
  
This is not meant to be a constructed card, but it's a solid common and I wouldn't turn up my nose at if you're drafting black.  
  
2.5/5
posts.html:

This is not meant to be a constructed card, but it's a solid common and I wouldn't turn up my nose at if you're drafting black.

2.5/5

Posted By: Gruesome-Tree (7/7/2012 6:33:29 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
1 star.  
  
Compare to blightning and lightning helix.  
  
These spells SHOULD have had a 2 black mana cost, and reach deeper into the flavor.  
  
3 damage does not trade with any playable 5 cmc creature, and thus -- this is only useful for killing lower-costed creatures, causing you to lose tempo.  
  
In a monoblack deck, the only decks that would run this under any circumstances, corrupt and Consume Spirit are better cards.  
  
This is essentially a strictly worse Consume Spirit, only made useful in drafts by having limited removal in ... limited.
posts.html:
1 star.

Compare to blightning and lightning helix.

These spells SHOULD have had a 2 black mana cost, and reach deeper into the flavor.

3 damage does not trade with any playable 5 cmc creature, and thus -- this is only useful for killing lower-costed creatures, causing you to lose tempo.

In a monoblack deck, the only decks that would run this under any circumstances, corrupt and Consume Spirit are better cards.

This is essentially a strictly worse Consume Spirit, only made useful in drafts by having limited removal in ... limited.

Posted By: Frostraven (2/2/2013 5:14:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Do remember that black isn't the strongest burn colour.   
Not only that, but this gives your a +6 life difference between your opponent and you. You're also given the option of smashing some pretentious [Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nighthawk)'s nose in.  
  
I'd say it's much better than [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) for these reasons. Neither are playable in constructed, but this gives you options. [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) can easily be a dead draw.
posts.html:
Do remember that black isn't the strongest burn colour.
Not only that, but this gives your a +6 life difference between your opponent and you. You're also given the option of smashing some pretentious Nighthawk's nose in.

I'd say it's much better than Lava Axe for these reasons. Neither are playable in constructed, but this gives you options. Lava Axe can easily be a dead draw.

Let me get this straight. Lightning Helix is ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) and an instant. This is ![4](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=4&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) and a sorcery.  
  
...Is black seriously that bad at dealing damage and gaining life at the same time? I mean, look at all the vampires they have! This should be a cakewalk for them! At least make it an instant, and have it cost ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) or something. Oh wait, we already have [Vampire Nighthawk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vampire Nighthawk) at that cost. 0.5/5
